question_details.fine_print:
This question concerns only CLT occupations in Brazil (registered workers), and will resolve to **Yes** even if employers find legal workarounds to keep hiring people in 6x1 work schedules after a ban.

In Brazil, a CLT worker is someone employed under the rules of the Consolidação das Leis do Trabalho (CLT), or the Consolidation of Labor Laws. This legislation governs employment relations and protects workers' rights in Brazil. Being a CLT worker means you’re formally employed and entitled to a range of rights and protections set out in Brazilian labor laws.

"Most CLT occupations" here means that the law lists no more than 5 exceptions to the general rule, affecting in total no more than 1% of the workforce
